Study Name: A large scale 12-lead electrocardiogram database for arrhythmia study: A 12-lead electrocardiogram database for arrhythmia research covering more than 10,000 patients
Location: Chapman University, Shaoxing People's Hospital (Shaoxing Hospital Zhejiang University School of Medicine), and Ningbo First Hospital
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Includes information about pre-existing conditions or symptoms

Study Name: A multi-camera and multimodal dataset for posture and gait analysis: Multimodal dataset with 166k samples for vision-based applications with a smart walker used in gait and posture rehabilitation. It is equipped with a pair of Depth cameras with data synchronized with an inertial MoCap system worn by the participant.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: No clinical history of any abnormalities
Data Collected (differnent levels of): walking straight in a corridor, turning right in a corner, turning left in a corner at speeds of 0.3, 0.5, and 0.7 m/s

Study Name: A Pressure Map Dataset for In-bed Posture Classification: Pressure sensor data captured from 13 participants in various sleeping postures.
Study sample size: Experiment 1: 13 participants               Experiment 2: 8 participants                                       Total # of Subjects Enrolled Altogether: 13
Instruments used: Experiment 1: Vista Medical FSA SoftFlex 2048               Experiment 2: Vista Medical BodiTrak BT3510
Data Collected (differnent levels of): in-bed posture pressure data

Study Name: A Wearable Exam Stress Dataset for Predicting Cognitive Performance in Real-World Settings: The data contains electrodermal activity, heart rate, blood volume pulse, skin surface temperature, inter beat interval and accelerometer data recorded during three exam sessions (midterm 1, midterm 2 and finals) as well as their corresponding grades
Data Collected (differnent levels of): electrodermal activity, heart rate, blood volume pulse, skin surface temperature, inter beat interval and accelerometer data

Study Name: Abdominal and Direct Fetal ECG Database
Age (mean±SD when available): 38-41 weeks in gestation; age of female patients not specified in PhysioNet or associated publication
Location: Department of Obstetrics at the Medical University of Silesia (Katowice, Poland)
Instruments used: KOMPOREL System (ITAM Institute, Zabrze, Poland). Each recording comprises 4 different signals acquired from

Study Name: AF Termination Challenge Database: ECG recordings created for the Computers in Cardiology Challenge 2004, which focused on predicting spontaneous termination of atrial fibrillation.
Study sample size: Three groups in Learning Set: 1.  Group N (non-terminating Atrial Fibrillation); 2. Group S (AF that terminates 1 minute after end of record); 3.  Group T (AF that terminates immediately (within 1 second) after end of record
Instruments used: Not listed; two ECG signals used

Study Name: AHA Database Sample Excluded Record: Two ECG signals that were excluded from the 1980 American Heart Association database.
Study sample size: 80 recordings (10 for each existing condition) for development set; 75 recordings for test set
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: No ventricular ectopy, isolated unifocal PVCs, isolated multifocal PVCs, ventricular bi- and trigeminy, R-on-T PVCs, ventricular couplets, ventricular tachycardia, ventricular flutter/fibrillation
Instruments used: Not listed; two ECG signals used

Study Name: ANSI/AAMI EC13 Test Waveforms: The files in this set can be used for testing a variety of devices that monitor the electrocardiogram. The recordings include both synthetic and real waveforms.
Instruments used: not listed; includes both synthetic and real waveforms
Data Collected (differnent levels of): Collection of ECG Recordings

Study Name: Apnea-ECG Database: Seventy ECG signals with expert-labelled apnea annotations and machine-generated QRS annotations.
Study sample size: 70 nightime ECG recordings and 31 subjects incorporated from 2 studies
Age (mean±SD when available): Class A: 50 (mean); 29-63 (range)              Class B: 46 (mean); 39-53 (range)            Class C: 33 (mean); 27-42            Average Age of Subjects Across all Classes: 43.87
Data Collected (differnent levels of): Each recording includes a continuous digitized ECG signal, a set of apnea annotations and a set of machine-generated QRS annotations (in which all beats regardless of type have been labeled normal).

Study Name: Auditory evoked potential EEG-Biometric dataset: Recording of electroencephalogram (EEG) signals with the aim to develop an EEG-based Biometric. The Data includes resting-state and auditory stimuli experiments.
Study sample size: 240 two-minute EEG recordings obtained from 20 volunteers
Instruments used: OpenBCI Ganglion Board, 200 Hz sampling rate, four channels: T7, F8, Cz, and P4.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): resting state EEG signals (in patients with eyes open and eyes closed)

Study Name: Autonomic Aging: A dataset to quantify changes of cardiovascular autonomic function during healthy aging: This database contains resting recordings of ECG and continuous noninvasive blood pressure of 1,104 healthy volunteers
Instruments used: Group 1: TFM: CNSystems Task Force Monitor                     Group 2: BIOPAC MP150 with CNSystems CNAP 500
Data Collected (differnent levels of): ECG and non-invasive blood pressure signals

Study Name: Behavioral and autonomic dynamics during propofol-induced unconsciousness: Multimodal point process indices for heart rate variability and electrodermal activity for 9 subjects who are undergoing a controlled propofol sedation experiment where the concentration was increased and then decreased in stages.
Instruments used: 2 electrodes placed on hand to measure electrodermal activity
Data Collected (differnent levels of): Continuous ECG and EDA were collected. LOC and ROC times were annotated based on the lack of patients' response to pressing a button

Study Name: BIDMC Congestive Heart Failure Database: Long-term ECG recordings from 15 subjects with severe congestive heart failure.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Severe congestive HF (NYHA Class 3-4)        -conventional medical therapy prior to receiving the oral inotropic agent, milrinone.
Instruments used: Ambulatory ECG recorders with bandwidth of 0.1 Hz.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): ECG recordings

Study Name: BIDMC PPG and Respiration Dataset: ECG signals extracted from the MIMIC-II Matched Waveform Database, with manual breath annotations added by annotators using impedance respiratory signal.
Age (mean±SD when available): -Median Age: 64.81  (unknown age for one patient)             -Age Range: 19-90+
Instruments used: CareVue Clinical Information System (models M2331A and M1215A                Component Monitoring System Intellivue MP-70; Philips Healthcare)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -PPG recordings and respiratory signals

Study Name: BIG IDEAs Lab Glycemic Variability and Wearable Device Data: Glucose measurements and wrist-worn wearable sensor data from highnormoglycemic participants.
Race: White/Caucasian: 11;        Black/African American: 4;         Biracial: 1;              Other: 0 (values obtained from supplementary table on associated publication)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: - only post-menopausal females                      -point of care A1C measurement between 5.2-6.4%, inclusive
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -measurement of glucose, hemoglobin A1C, lipoproteins, and triglycerides                        -heart rate, accelerometry, and electrodermal conductance

Study Name: Body Sway When Standing and Listening to Music Modified to Reinforce Virtual Reality Environment Motion: This data were intended to show that music manipulated to match VR motion provided by an Oculus Rift head mounted display increased body sway when standing still.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: -Subjects did not have any of the following exclusion criteria: vertigo, motion sickness, or vestibular deficits
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -anterior posterior (AP) and medial lateral (ML) center of pressure movement                                                -subjects experienced combinations of 3 visual conditions (VR translation in the AP direction at 0.1 Hz, no translation, and eyes closed) and 4 music conditions (Mozart’s Jupiter Symphony modified to scale volume at 0.1 Hz and 0.25 Hz, unmodified music, and no music

Study Name: Brain Hemorrhage Extended (BHX): Bounding box extrapolation from thick to thin slice CT images
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: -excluded postoperative scans and scans of patients younger than 7 years.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -dataset head CT scans and respective clinical reports                   -annotations of  bounding box annotations for 5 types of acute hemorrhage (Intraparenchymal, Subarachnoid, Intraventricular, Epidural, Subdural, and extra sixth label for Chronic Subdural Hematoma)

Study Name: Brno University of Technology ECG Quality Database (BUT QDB): The database is intended for the development and objective comparison of algorithms designed to assess the quality of ECG records. It also enables objective comparison of results between authors.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: -Patients took part in all "free-living conditions" with the Bittius Faros 180 device (except for bathing, showering, and swimming in order to protect the device)
Instruments used: -Bittium Faros 180 device (ECG recorder with integrated accelerometer)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -ECG and accelerometer signals

Study Name: Brno University of Technology ECG Signal Database with Annotations of P Wave (BUT PDB)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: -There are 23 different types of pathology are present (atrial premature beat, atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, ventricular bigeminy, atrioventricular block 1st degree, atrioventricular block 2nd degree, atrioventricular block 3rd degree, ventricular escape beat, fusion of ventricular and normal beat, idioventricular rhythm, nodal beat, left bundle branch block beat, sinus arrythmia, nodal rhythm, paced rhythm, pre-excitation, right bundle branch block beat, supraventricular ventricular bigeminy, ventricular premature beat, ventricular flutter, ventricular pair, aberrated atrial premature beat)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -ECG signal database with marked P waves                   -data collected from three existing databases of ECG signal - the MIT-BIH Arrhythmia Database, the MIT-BIH Supraventricular Arrhythmia Database, and the Long Term AF Database

Study Name: Brno University of Technology Smartphone PPG Database (BUT PPG)
Instruments used: -smartphone Xiaomi Mi9 (with sampling frequency of 30 Hz) for collection of PPG data               -Bittium Faros 360 (mobile ECG recorder) with sampling frequency of 1000 Hz for collection of reference ECG signals
Data Collected (differnent levels of): - evaluating PPG quality and estimation of heart rate (HR); also collected pertinent reference ECG signals                     -Each PPG signal includes annotation of quality and reference HR. PPG signal quality is indicated binary: 1 indicates good quality for HR estimation, 0 indicates signals where HR cannot be detected reliably and thus these signals are unsuitable for any analysis.

Study Name: CAP Sleep Database
Location: Parma, Italy (Sleep Disorders Center of the Ospedale Maggiore)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: -The 16 healthy subjects included in the study did not present any neurological disorders and were free of drugs affecting the central nervous system. The 92 pathological recordings include 40 recordings of patients diagnosed with NFLE, 22 affected by RBD, 10 with PLM, 9 insomniac, 5 narcoleptic, 4 affected by SDB and 2 by bruxism.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -periodic EEG activity occurring during NREM sleep (polysomnographic recordings);                      -characterized by cyclic sequences of cerebral activation (phase A) followed by periods of deactivation (phase B) which separate two successive phase A periods with an interval <1 min.

Study Name: Cardiorespiratory measurement from graded cycloergometer exercise testing
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Participants belonged to a national division of fencing, or a regional division of sprint kayak and triathlon
Instruments used: SRM Indoor Trainer electronic cycloergometer (Schoberer Rad Meßtechnik, Jülich, Germany); Metalyzer 3B gas analyzer system (CORTEX Biophysik GmbH, Leipzig, Germany); Electro Cardiogramm (ECG) recordings (Cardio 110BT, Customed, Ottobrunn, Germany, with 12 derivations)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): - cardiorespiratory measurements acquired during 18 cycloergometer maximal graded exercise tests ;   -Data correspond to heart R-wave to R-wave intervals, Oxygen consumption, and mechanical power output on a beat-to-beat basis recorded all along the graded exercise test sessions;       -Clinical data of the participants (i.e. age, Weight, Height, Power at ventilatory threshold 1 and 2, and sport discipline) also collected

Study Name: CAST RR Interval Sub-Study Database
Study sample size: -734 patients, of whom 69 died during the study period;                       -database also includes data from 75 additional subjects for whom only one acceptable recording was available but who satisfied the other selection criteria
Age (mean±SD when available): 60 ± 10 (males);      63 ± 8 (females)                   in raw .hea data files on PhysioNet, only age range instead of specific age is given for each patient
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms:
- CAST patients were post MI and had ≥ 6 ventricular premature complexes/h on pretreatment recordin;        -In original study, patients were randomly assigned to receive Encainide, Flecainide, and Moricizine;            -had usable pre-treatment and on-therapy recordings, based on data collected during the original CAST and CAST II studies
-received a randomly-assigned antiarrhythmic treatment that successfully reduced their PVC rates by at least 80% on the first attempt, and
-continued on that treatment.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -Frequency domain anlaysis of heartrate variability

Study Name: Cerebral perfusion and cognitive decline in type 2 diabetes
Study sample size: 140 (70 with Type II Diabetes mellitus; 70 control) as reported in PhysioNet summary description; however, associated csv summary data file only shows 88 records (13 control; 75 Diabetes Mellitus)
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms:
-Experiemntal Group had Type II Diabetes and were treated for at least 1 year; Control Group were not being treated for any systemic cardiovascular, renal, or 
neurological disease and with no focal deficit on neurological exam, had normal glucose and HbA1c, and 
were normotensive (BP<140/90mm Hg) or diagnosed with hypertension.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -Blood flow velocities were measured in the anterior and middle cerebral arteries using transcranial Doppler ultrasound. Cerebral vasoregulation was evaluated by comparing blood flow velocity responses during hypocapnia and hypercapnia, Valsalva maneuver, head-up tilt and sit-to-stand test using simultaneous recordings of cardiovascular variables, blood flow velocity in the anterior and middle cerebral artery using transcranial Doppler and respiratory variables.

Study Name: Cerebral Vasoregulation in Diabetes
Ethnicity: Hispanic and Latino (2); only Hispanic (1); Non-Hispanic and Non-Latino (47)
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Instruments used: General Electric 3.0 Tesla VHI scanner (TCD and MRI);
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -continuous measurements of cerebral blood flow using transcranial Doppler and MRI, heart rate, blood pressure, and respiratory parameters, balance, walking, laboratory and retinopathy measures.

Study Name: Cerebral Vasoregulation in Elderly with Stroke
Race: White (139), African American (26), American Indian (1), Asian (5), Unknown (1)
Study sample size: 120 patients (60 suffered stroke; 60 control patients) (noted on description page of Physionet); however, raw data files on PhysioNet indicate that a total of 197 patients were initially enrolled (which were reported in our general data table)
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Subjects with brain hemorrhage, diabetes mellitus, significant arrythmias, uncontrolled hypertension, morbid obesity, controls with carotid stenosis or cases with contralateral stenosis were excluded
Instruments used: 3-D positioning probe holder (PMD150 Spencer Technologies, Inc., WA); 3-lead electrocardiogram (SpaceLab Medical, Issaquah, WA); Finapress device (Ohmeda Monitoring Systems, Englewood, CO); Capnomac Ultima
Data Collected (differnent levels of): -transcranial doppler of cerebral arteries, 24-h blood pressure numerics, high resolution waveforms (ECG, blood pressure, CO2 and respiration) during various movement tasks, 24-h ECG, EMG, and accelerometer recordings, and gait pressure recordings during a walking test

Study Name: Cerebromicrovascular Disease in Elderly with Diabetes: Type 2 diabetes increases risk for cerebrovascular disease, cognitive and mobility decline in older people. This project evaluated relationship between diabetes, inflammation cerebrovascular reactivity and functional outcomes.
Race: White (94), African American (21), Asian (1), Latino (3), Unknown/Other (3),    ****Note: Demographics for this study were only reported for Part 1 of the study
Study sample size: 120 patients (60 people had diabetes; 60 people in control group) (noted on PhysioNet);              147 patients (71 diabetic; 76 nondiabetic) (on PubMed publication)
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Exclusion criteria were type 1 diabetes; recent history of stroke or myocardial infarction; dementia; significant cardiac, renal, neurologic, and kidney disorders; claustrophobia; and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)-incompatible implants.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): effects of type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) on cerebral vasoregulation, perfusion and functional outcomes, measured by blood flow responses to hypocapnia and hypercapnia, Valsalva maneuver, head-up tilt, and sit-to-stand test.

Study Name: CHARIS database: Multi-channel recordings of ECG, arterial blood pressure (ABP), and intracranial pressure (ICP) of patients diagnosed with traumatic brain injury.
Location: Rutgers, New Jersey (Robert Wood Johnson Medical Center)
Instruments used: General Electric TRAM-rac 4A; micro transducers (Camino Direct Pressure Monitor, Camino Laboratories, San Diego, CA; fluid-filled catheter (Arterial Line, Edwards LifeSciences Inc.).
Data Collected (differnent levels of): multi-channel recordings of ECG, arterial blood pressure (ABP), and intracranial pressure (ICP) of patients diagnosed with traumatic brain injury (TBI).

Study Name: CHB-MIT Scalp EEG Database: EEG recordings from pediatric subjects with intractable seizures, collected at the Children’s Hospital Boston.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): EEG recordings from pediatric subjects with intractable seizures

Study Name: CiPA ECG Validation Study: ECG effects of ranolazine, verapamil, lopinavir+ritonavir, chloroquine, dofetilide, diltiazem, and dofetilide+diltiazem in a small clinical study.
Instruments used: ECG recordings were performed using the Mortara Surveyor system sampled at 500 Hz with an amplitude resolution of 2.5 μV
Data Collected (differnent levels of): multi-channel ECG recordings

Study Name: Clinical data from the MIMIC-II database for a case study on indwelling arterial catheters: Dataset extracted from MIMIC-II for a tutorial on effectiveness of indwelling arterial catheters in hemodynamically stable patients with respiratory failure for mortality outcomes.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: patients who were mechanically ventilated during the first day of ICU admissio
Data Collected (differnent levels of): 46 variables, including demographics (e.g. age, weight), clinical observations collected during the first day of ICU stay (e.g. white blood cell count, heart rate), and outcomes (e.g. 28 day mortality and length of stay).

Study Name: Combined measurement of ECG, Breathing and Seismocardiograms: ECG and seismocardiogram data collected from 20 presumed healthy volunteers.
Study sample size: 20 patients (60 records) as reported on Physionet; 17 patients as reported in associated publication
Instruments used: Biopac MP36 data acquisition system (Santa Barbara, CA, USA); respiratory signal obtained from a thoracic piezoresistive band (SS5LB sensor by Biopac, Santa Barbara, CA, USA)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): measurement of ECG, Breathing and Seismocardiograms

Study Name: Complex Upper-Limb Movements: Hand trajectory data collected from ten subjects as they performed various upper-limb motor tasks.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patients with no known neurological or orthopedic conditions affecting the control of motion
Instruments used: camera-based motion capture system (VICON, Oxford UK)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): x-, y-, and z-coordinates of the reflective marker utilized in each experiment to represent the hand trajectory of movement

Study Name: Congestive Heart Failure RR Interval Database: This database includes beat annotation files for 29 long-term ECG recordings of subjects aged 34 to 79, with congestive heart failure (NYHA classes I, II, and III).
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patients had congestive heart failure (NYHA classes I, II, and III)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): ECG recordings

Study Name: Continuous Cuffless Monitoring of Arterial Blood Pressure via Graphene Bioimpedance Tattoos: Cuffless blood pressure data repository that includes raw time data for 4-channel Bioimpedance signals using Graphene Tattoos from the wrist with synchronized continuous blood pressure and PPG signals from 7 subjects
Location: College Station, University of Texas A&M
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: No individuals with hypertension were specifically selected for this proof-of-concept study.
Instruments used: analog-to-digital converter (ADS1278, Texas Instruments, USA);  Finapres NOVA BP system.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): raw time data for the 4-channel GET Bioimpedance signals with BP and PPG signals

Study Name: CPAP Pressure and Flow Data from a Local Trial of 30 Adults at the University of Canterbury: A pressure and flow dataset was collected from a trial of 30 adults at the University of Canterbury undergoing CPAP therapy for a variety of instructed breath rates at PEEP levels of 4cmH2O and 7cmH2O.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: 30 healthy patients studied (also included vapers, smokers, and asthmatics)
Instruments used: dual-Venturi apparatus (Figure 2) with central expiration hole was 3D printed to fit standard CPAP masks (FreeMotion RT041, Fisher and Paykel Healthcare, New Zealand); central Arduino unit (Nano V3, Baite Electronics, China) in analogue-to-digital converter (ADC) counts; differential pressure sensors (Sensirion AG SDP816-125PA) and gauge pressure sensors (NXP MPVZ4006GW7U)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): PAP Pressure and Flow Data

Study Name: CTU-CHB Intrapartum Cardiotocography Database
Age (mean±SD when available): Maternal subjects: avergage is 29.8 (18-46)                 average gestational age: 40 weeks (range: 37 weeks - 43)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms:
Singleton pregnancy
Gestational age >36 weeks
No a priori known developmental defects
Duration of stage 2 of labor ≤ 30 minutes
FHR signal quality (i.e. percentage of the recording during which FHR data were available) > 50% in each 30 minute window
Available analysis of biochemical parameters of umbilical arterial blood sample (i.e. pH)
Majority of vaginal deliveries (only 46 cesarean section (CS) deliveries included)
Instruments used: The CTGs were recorded using STANS21 and S31 (NeoventaMedical,Mölndal,Sweden) and AvalonFM40 and FM50 (PhilipsHealthcare,Andover,MA) fetalmonitors. All CTG signals were stored in an Electronicform in the OB TraceVue®system (Philips)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): cardiotocography recordings

Study Name: CU Ventricular Tachyarrhythmia Database: This database includes 35 eight-minute ECG recordings of human subjects who experienced episodes of sustained ventricular tachycardia, ventricular flutter, and ventricular fibrillation.
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: subjects who experienced episodes of sustained ventricular tachycardia, ventricular flutter, and ventricular fibrillation.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): 8-minute ECG recordings

Study Name: CUILESS2016: A corpus of Concept Unique Identifier concepts taken from the SemEval2015 Task 14.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): corpus of "CUI-less" concepts taken from the SemEval2015 Task 14 that have been assigned CUIs.

Study Name: ECG Effects of Dofetilide, Moxifloxacin, Dofetilide+Mexiletine, Dofetilide+Lidocaine and Moxifloxacin+Diltiazem
Race: White (10); Black or African American (10), Asian (1), American Indian or Alaskan Native (1)
Study sample size: 22 patients; original raw data had 4211 original extracted 10-second standard 12 lead ECG segments)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): continuous ECG recordings

Study Name: ECG Effects of Ranolazine, Dofetilide, Verapamil, and Quinidine
Study sample size: 22 stated in PhysoNet; Raw directory has  5232 original extracted 10-second standard 12 lead ECG segments
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: healthy patients; CRITERIA: without a history of heart disease or unexplained syncope or a family history of long QT syndrome; to be 18–35 years of age, weigh at least 50 kg, and have a body mass index of 18–27 kg/m2; and to be able to read and understand the informed consent.
Instruments used: 2-lead ECG recorder (Surveyor, Mortara Instrument, Milwaukee, WI) using the Mason–Likar52 electrode configuration; Plasma drug concentration was determined using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectroscopy method by Frontage Laboratories (Exton, Philadelphia, PA).
Data Collected (differnent levels of): multi-channel ECG recordings

Study Name: ECG Fragment Database for the Exploration of Dangerous Arrhythmia
Study sample size: Each of six classes represented by sample of 90 objects (total of 540 objects)
Location: No stated physical location; collected from MIT-BIH Malignant Ventricular Ectopy Database
Data Collected (differnent levels of): 2 second fragments of ECG signals

Study Name: ECG-ID Database: ECG recordings from 90 volunteers.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): single-lead ECG recordings

Study Name: EEG During Mental Arithmetic Tasks
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: The participants were eligible to enroll in the study if they had normal or corrected-to-normal visual acuity, normal color vision, had no clinical manifestations of mental or cognitive impairment, verbal or non-verbal learning disabilities. Exclusion criteria were the use of psychoactive medication, drug or alcohol addiction and psychiatric or neurological complaints.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): EEG recordings of subjects before and during the performance of mental arithmetic tasks.

Study Name: EEG Motor Movement/Imagery Dataset
Study sample size: data set consists of over 1500 one- and two-minute EEG recordings, obtained from 109 volunteers
Instruments used: 64-channel EEG were recorded using the BCI2000 system (http://www.bci2000.org)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): 64 channel EEG recordings while subjects were performing different motor/imagery tasks

Study Name: EEG Signals from an RSVP Task: This project contains EEG data from 11 healthy participants upon rapid presentation of images through the Rapid Serial Visual Presentation (RSVP) protocol at speeds of 5, 6, and 10 Hz.
Age (mean±SD when available): 24.3 ± 3.7 (range of 19-33) (noted on associated publication, not on Physionet page/summary nor raw data files)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patients had normal or corrected-to-normal vision
Instruments used: BioSemi ActiveTwo system at a sample rate of 2048 Hz (collecting EEG signals)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): contains EEG data from patients after presentation of images through the Rapid Serial Visual Presentation (RSVP) protocol at speeds of 5, 6, and 10 Hz

Study Name: Effect of 24-hour sleep deprivation on cerebral hemodynamics and cognitive performance
Study sample size: originally 10 subjects; 1 subject excluded due to poor quality of NIRS signals
Instruments used: NIRScout platform (NIRx Medical Technologies LLC, NY, USA) for NIRS measurements
Data Collected (differnent levels of): functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS) measurements and recordings

Study Name: Effect of Deep Brain Stimulation on Parkinsonian Tremor: Rest tremor velocity in the index finger of 16 subjects with Parkinson's disease who receive chronic high frequency electrical deep brain stimulation.
Age (mean±SD when available): Patients with high amplitude tremor: 58.5 ±  9.8;     Patients with low amplitude tremor: 52.8 ± 10.2
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patients had Parkinson's Disease. In this study, patients were dividided into two groups: patients with high amplitude tremor and patients with low amplitude tremor
Data Collected (differnent levels of): rest tremor velocity in the index finger of patients with Parkinson's Disease

Study Name: eICU Collaborative Research Database Demo: An openly available subset of the eICU Collaborative Research Database.
Race: 160 African Americans, 25 Asians, 1462 Caucasians, 9 Native Americans, 66 marked as Unknown/Unreported, 28 not reported on datasheet, 91 Hispanics
Ethnicity: Wrote Hispanics under Race instead of Ethnicity
Study sample size: demo dataset contains data associated with (ICU) stays for over 2,521 unit stays selected from 20 of the larger hospitals in the eICU Collaborative Research Database; total number of patients reported in raw csv patient data files were 1841 (after removal of redundant patient unique IDs)
Instruments used: Data is collected through the Philips eICU program (telehealth program)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): multi-center database comprised of deidentified health data for over 200,000 admissions to ICUs across the United States between 2014-2015. The database includes vital sign measurements, care plan documentation, severity of illness measures, diagnosis information, and treatment information.

Study Name: Electrocardiogram, skin conductance and respiration from spider-fearful individuals watching spider video clips: Dataset used for development of an algorithm for on-line anxiety level detection from biosignals.
Study sample size: 57 on PhysioNet database; 80 in associated publication
Age (mean±SD when available): not specified in this PhysioNet  dataset; however, in original publication, 80 subjects aged between 18 and 40 years participated in the study
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: All individuals studied were scared of spiders.
Instruments used: wearable BITalino biosignal measurement device (PLUX – Wireless Biosignals S.A., Lisbon, Portugal)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): lectrocardiogram, skin conductance and respiration as raw data (unfiltered, unprocessed) recorded from consented, spider-fearful individuals using the wearable BITalino biosignal measurement device

Study Name: EPHNOGRAM: A Simultaneous Electrocardiogram and Phonocardiogram Database
Age (mean±SD when available): 25.4 ± 1.9,age is missing for three of the male subjects
Instruments used: Study developed their own instrument for simultaneous ECG and PCG recordings
Data Collected (differnent levels of): evelopment of low-cost and low-power devices for recording simultaneous electrocardiogram (ECG) and phonocardiogram (ECG) data, with auxiliary channels for capturing environmental audio noise, which could be used for PCG quality enhancement through signal processing.

Study Name: ERP-based Brain-Computer Interface recordings: Data generated as part of a study aimed at identifying the factors limiting the performance of brain-computer interfaces based on event-related potentials.
Study sample size: 12 separate folders for each subject in raw data of Physionet; however, the summary only reports 10 subjects
Instruments used: Data were collected using a BioSemi ActiveTwo EEG system sampled at 2048 Hz.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): P300 amplitude changes

Study Name: European ST-T Database: Annotated excerpts of ambulatory ECG recordings from 79 subjects, designed for evaluation of algorithms for analysis of ST and T-wave changes.
Age (mean±SD when available): Men: 30-84;      Women: 55-71               Average Age: 54.6 (ages for two participants are missing on Physionet raw data hea files)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): ambulatory ECG recordings

Study Name: Evoked Auditory Responses in Heading Impaired: Auditory Brainstem Response and Otoacoustic Emission recordings in eight hearing impaired listeners.
Age (mean±SD when available): Average: 68.8 (not reported in summary; calculated by analyzing raw hea files);    Age range based on analyzing raw data files is 40-87, although it reports 40-85 on Physionet description of data
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patients with known history of hearing impairment confirmed through clinical tests and thresholds higher than 25 dB HL (at least one octave frequency between 250 Hz to 8 kHz)
Instruments used: stimuli were generated in MATLAB (2006b running on Ubuntu) and converted from digital (48-kHz sampling frequency) to analog using a 24-bit Lynx Two sound card. The analog signal was then passed through a Tucker-Davis Technologies HB7 headphone buffer and presented monaurally via the two transducers of the Etymotic ER-10C to a listener inside a double-walled sound-attenuating booth.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): contains evoked Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR) and Otoacoustic Emission (OAE) recordings in hearing impaired individuals

Study Name: Evoked Auditory Responses in Normals: Auditory Brainstem Response and Otoacoustic Emission recordings generated as part of a study examining evoked potentials and loudness growth.
Age (mean±SD when available): 19-31 (stated in publication but not on PhysioNet)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patients had no history of hearing difficulties and their audiometric thresholds did not exceed 15 DB HL at octave frequencies from 250 Hz to 8 kHz
Instruments used: electrode signal was then sent to a GRASS QP511 Quad AC Amplifier, where it was band-pass filtered from 30-3000 Hz, amplified by a factor of 50000, sent to a 32-bit Lynx Two Soundcard (outside the booth), and sampled at 48 kHz
Data Collected (differnent levels of): auditory brainstem response (ABR) and otoacoustic emissions (OAE) and two sets of psychoacoustical estimates of loudness as a function of peak sound pressure level (peSPL

Study Name: Examples of Electromyograms
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patient 1 had no history of neuromuscular disease; Patient 2 had chronic low back pain and neuropathy due to a right L5 radiculopathy; Patient 3 had myopathy due to longstanding history of polymyositis, treated effectively with steroids and low-dose methotrexate
Instruments used: Medelec Synergy N2 EMG Monitoring System (Oxford Instruments Medical, Old Woking, United Kingdom)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): electromyogram data from individuals with or without neuromuscular disease

Study Name: Eye Tracking Dataset for the 12-Lead Electrocardiogram Interpretation of Medical Practitioners and Students: The project aims at collecting a dataset using eye-tracking technology to understand the 12-lead electrocardiogram interpretation visual behavior for medical practitioners and students with different expertise levels.
Study sample size: 63 different medical practitioners from five expertise categories interpreted ten different ECGs each
Age (mean±SD when available):
20 - 23yrs: n = 10
23 - 25yrs: n = 9
26 - 30yrs: n = 21
30 - 35yrs: n = 11
35 - 45yrs: n = 12 (Mean age was 28 for all groups)
Location: Ar Rayyan, Qatar (Qatar Biomedical Research Institute, Hamad bin Khalifa University); Doha, Qatar (Hamad Medical Corporation)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: All worked in the healthcare fiedl
Instruments used: Tobii Pro X2-60 eye tracker and iMotions version 8.1 software
Data Collected (differnent levels of): Eye tracking movement of medical practioners and students when analyzing electrocardiograms

Study Name: Fantasia Database: ECG and respiration signals collected from 40 young and elderly subjects during supine resting.
Study sample size: 40 (20 young subjects and 20 elderly patients) stated on PhysioNet; however, on actual publication, it instead says 20 total subjects (10 young and 10 elderly)
Age (mean±SD when available): Twenty young (21 - 34 years old) patients; twenty elderly (68 - 85 years old) stated on PhysioNet
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): continuous ECG recordings and respirations signals (as well as uncalibrated continuous non-invasive blood pressure signal in half of the group) while nderwent 120 minutes of continuous supine resting while watching the Disney movie, Fantasia

Study Name: Fetal ECG Synthetic Database
Study sample size: 10 (simulated pregnant women) x 7 (cases) x 5 (SNR levels) x 5 (repetitions) = 1750 synthetic signals were produced
Instruments used: data is generated using the FECGSYN simulator
Data Collected (differnent levels of): simulated adult and non-invasive fetal ECG (NI-FECG) signals

Study Name: Fetal PCG Database
Study sample size: 35 pregnant women (stated in original publication, not on PhysioNet); 26 fetal PCG signals recorded
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: All women were healthy and also pregnant during the last months of their singleton physiological pregnancies (gestational week between 31 and 40)
Instruments used: portable phonocardiographic device (Fetaphon Monitoring System by Pentavox)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): fPCG signals were recorded

Study Name: Gait in Aging and Disease Database: Walking stride interval time series from 15 subjects.
Age (mean±SD when available): Three groups: 5 healthy young adults (23 - 29 years old), 5 healthy old adults (71 - 77 years old), and 5 older adults (60 - 77 years old)
Location: Boston, Massachusetts (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: 10 patients were classified as healthy while 5 remaining patients had Parkinson's Disease
Instruments used: The stride interval was measured using ultra-thin, force sensitive resistors placed inside the shoe. The analog force signal was sampled at 300 Hz with a 12 bit A/D converter, using an ambulatory, ankle-worn microcomputer that also recorded the data (not specified on PhysioNet)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): Walking stride interval time series from healthy patients walking in a circle and patients with Parkinson's walking up and down a hallway

Study Name: Gait in Neurodegenerative Disease Database: Database of simulated adult and non-invasive fetal ECG signals.
Age (mean±SD when available): Control age range: 20-95;       Huntington's Disease age range: 45-102;                Parkinson's Disease: 43-100;           ALS age range: 36-70
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: The records in this database are from patients with Parkinson's disease (n = 15), Huntington's disease (n = 20), or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (n = 13). Records from 16 healthy control subjects are also included here.
Instruments used: To measure the gait rhythm and the timing of the gait cycle, force-sensitive insoles (16) were placed in the subject's sho
Data Collected (differnent levels of): gait rhythm via time series data

Study Name: Gait in Parkinson's Disease: This database contains measures of gait from 93 patients with idiopathic PD (mean age: 66.3 years; 63% men), and 73 healthy controls (mean age: 66.3 years; 55% men). The database includes the vertica…
Study sample size: 166 total subjects: 93 had Parkinson's and 73 were healthy subjects
Age (mean±SD when available): idiopathic Parkinson's Disease Group (mean age: 66.3 years);       Healthy group (mean age: 66.3 years)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Portion of subjects had Parkinson's Disease (experimental group), while control gorup composed of all healthy patients
Instruments used: 8 sensors (Ultraflex Computer Dyno Graphy, Infotronic Inc.) that measure force (in Newtons) as a function of time
Data Collected (differnent levels of): vertical ground reaction force records of subjects as they walked at their usual, self-selected pace for approximately 2 minutes on level ground. database also includes demographic information, measures of disease severity (i.e., using the Hoehn & Yahr staging and/or the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale) and other related measures

Study Name: Gait Maturation Database
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: All children were healthy. Children were excluded if they had any disorders likely to affect gait, if they were unable to walk independently for 8 min, or if they were born prematurely.
Instruments used: Two force-sensitive switches were placed inside the subject's right shoe: one underneath the heel of the foot and the other underneath the ball of the foot (not specified)
Data Collected (differnent levels of): The first column is the time (in seconds), and the second column is the stride interval (in seconds) or the gait cycle duration, the time from heel strike to heel strike of the same foot

Study Name: Gesture Recognition and Biometrics ElectroMyogram (GRABMyo)
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: all healthy participants. Individuals with any existing muscle pain, skin allergies, and those who were unable to complete the three sessions due to any unprecedent circumstances were excluded from the study.
Instruments used: The EMGUSB2 + (OT Bioelettronica, Italy), a commercial amplifier, was used for acquiring the sEMG signals. The gain of the device was set to 500, and the sampling rate was set to 2048 Hz. Pre-gelled skin-adhesive monopolar sEMG electrodes (AM-N00S/E, Ambu, Denmark) were used.
Data Collected (differnent levels of): electromyogram (EMG) recordings collected from the wrist and forearm muscles while performing hand gestures

Study Name: Haaglanden Medisch Centrum sleep staging database
Pre-existing conditions and/or Symptoms: Patients were not subjected to any other treatment nor prescribed any additional behavior outside of the usual clinical procedures
Instruments used: SOMNOscreen PSG, PSG+, and EEG 10-20 recorders (SOMNOmedics, Germany) using AgAgCl electrodes
Data Collected (differnent levels of): contains electroencephalographic (EEG), electrooculographic (EOG), chin electromyographic (EMG), and electrocardiographic (ECG) activity, as well as event annotations corresponding to scoring of sleep patterns (hypnogram) performed by sleep technicians

Study Name: Heart Rate Oscillations during Meditation: Heart rate time series for 5 different groups of healthy subjects performing meditation techniques.
Age (mean±SD when available): Group 1: 20–35, mean 29; Group 2: 20–35, mean 25; Group 3: 21–55, mean 39
Location: Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, Boston
Data Collected (differnent levels of): heart rate oscillations from healthy patients performing various forms of yoga
